title: A Peat Bog As Big As England, And A Rare Glimpse At Earth's History
teaser: Dr. Simon Lewis of the University of Leeds has discovered a vast peatland in a remote part of the Republic of Congo. The bog covers an area the size of England and is thought to contain billions of tons of peat. Scientists say that investigating the carbon-rich material could shed light on 10,000 years of environmental change in this little-studied region.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
